data.event: The railway station was opened in 1888 on the Blayney - Demondrille line which connected the Main Western Line at Blayney and the Main Southern Line at Demondrille railway station.
Gold was discovered in 1868 at Woods Flat, a few kilometres south of Woodstock.
The goldfield had a long history but today almost nothing remains of the buildings at Woods Flat.
Initially known also as Woods Flat, the name of the village was changed to Woodstock in 1886.
